item.title: How I Cleared the eJPT: Honest Experience and What It Actually Taught Me
item.description:
Exam Duration and Difficulty

I recently cleared the eJPT (eLearnSecurity Junior Penetration Tester) exam, and overall, it was a very solid learning experience. I completed the exam in about 35 hours, including sleep. While it wasn‚Äôt extremely hard to pass, I wouldn‚Äôt call it easy either. I‚Äôd place it somewhere between intermediate and hard, especially if you‚Äôre completely new to penetration testing.

More About Penetration Testing Than Web Apps

One thing that surprised me was that the exam is not very focused on web application penetration testing. There is some web-related work, but most of the exam feels more like real-world network and system-level penetration testing. You spend more time enumerating services, exploiting misconfigurations, moving through systems, and understanding how different parts of the network connect, which I personally enjoyed a lot.

item.title: Completed CompTIA Security+ ‚Äî My Experience and Learnings

item.title: Welcome to Akshat On Security
item.description:
Hi, I’m Akshat Agarwal, a cybersecurity enthusiast and BCA (Hons.) student at Christ University, Bangalore, India.
I‚Äôm currently studying for the CompTIA Security+ certification, and this blog is where I document my journey ‚Äî from tutorials and notes to projects and practical cybersecurity insights.

This platform is also part of my effort to build a strong profile for applying to internships in cybersecurity.
If you‚Äôre a beginner, a fellow learner, or a recruiter ‚Äî you‚Äôre in the right place.
